The document is part of a collection of programming examples for Panda3D, with each sample providing an overview of specific features. This particular entry discusses "Shadows," a program demonstrating shadow maps for dynamic shadowing in Panda3D. It includes setup instructions, OS-specific locations, screenshots, and links to related content within the broader collection of sample programs.

Sample Programs: Shadows

To run a sample program, you need to install Panda3D. If you're a Windows user, you'll find the sample programs in your start menu. If you're a Linux user, you'll find the sample programs in /usr/share/panda3d.

Screenshots

Explanation

This program shows how to use shadow maps in Panda3D. This is a technique for dynamic shadowing.
